sentences.sentence: The Brave Little Tailor( 裁缝 )
One summer morning a little tailor was sitting at his table near the window, and working happily, when an old woman came down the street crying,
“Good jam( 果酱 ) to sell! Good jam to sell!”
The tailor liked jam very much, so he put his head out of the window, and called out,
“Come up here if you want to do some good business.”
So the poor woman climbed the steps with her heavy basket.
The tailor asked her to unpack( 打开 ) her bags and show him every single pot( 罐 ) of jam.
He looked at every one of them, lifted all the lids( 盖子 ), carefully smelled each one of them, and said at last,
“The jam seems pretty good; I will buy a quarter of a pound of it.”
The woman, who had expected to find a good customer, gave him what he asked for, but went away angry and disappointed( 失望的 ).
“This jam is just what I need,” said the little tailor.
“It will give me strength.”
He took down a loaf( 条 ) of bread from the cupboard( 橱柜 ), cut a slice( 薄皮 ), and spread the jam on it.
He ate a little, then put it down beside him and went on with his work.
But the smell of the sweet jam was spreading through the room and attracted( 吸引 ) many flies, who quite agreed with the tailor that the jam was delicious.
“Who asked you to come?” said the tailor, and politely told his uninvited guests to leave.
But the flies, not understanding his language, would not leave, and returned in larger numbers than before.
Then the tailor picked up a piece of cloth( 布 ) and said, “Now, I’ll let you have it!” and hit out hard at the flies.
When he counted the dead, he found that he had killed no less than seven.
“This is quite an achievement!” he thought. “The whole town shall know this.”
So he made a belt( 腰带 ), and he stitched( 缝合 ) it, and put on it in large capital letters the words, “Seven at one blow!”
“The town, did I say!” said the little tailor.
“The whole world shall know it!” And his heart quivered( 颤动 ) with joy( 喜悦 ), like a lamb’s tail.
The tailor put on the belt, and began to think of going out into the world, for his workshop( 作坊 ) seemed too small for a man of his greatness.
So he looked about the house for something that it would be useful to take with him.
But all he could find was an old cheese( 乳酪 ), which he put in his pocket.
Outside the door he noticed that a bird had got caught in the bushes( 灌木丛 ), so he took that and put it in his pocket with the cheese.
Then he set out, happy and full of energy.
The way led over a mountain, and when he reached the highest peak( 山顶 ) he saw a terrible giant( 巨人 ) sitting there, looking out over the flat land below.
The tailor went bravely up to him, called out to him, and said,
“Friend, good day! There you sit, looking over the wide world! I am going there to seek my fortune( 寻找成功之路 ): would you like to come with me?”
The giant looked at the tailor contemptuously( 轻蔑地 ), and said,
“Why should I come with you? I can see you are good for nothing!”
“Really?” answered the little tailor, and he undid( 解开 ) his coat and showed the giant his belt( 腰带 ).
“You can read there whether I am a man or not!”
The giant read: “Seven at one blow!” and thinking it meant that the tailor had killed seven men, felt at once more respect for the little fellow.
But as he wanted to test him, he took up a stone and squeezed( 挤，捏 ) it so hard that water came out of it.
“Now do that,” said the giant, “that is, if you have the strength for it.”
“That’s easy,” said the little tailor.
“I could do that even when I was a child.”
Then he put his hand in his pocket and took out the cheese and squeezed it, so that the whey( 乳清 ) ran out of it.
“Well,” said he, “what do you think of that?”

article_info.previous: 在王宫厨房做帮佣的公主渐渐忘掉了过去，变得随遇而安。在王子举行婚礼的那天，公主藏在门后悄悄地观察大厅，十分后悔之前的所作所为。King Thrushbeard邀请公主跳舞，原来King Thrushbeard就是公主的乞丐丈夫，真相大白，King Thrushbeard和公主举行了盛大的婚礼。
article_info.share_words: The tailor asked her to unpack her bags and show him every single pot of jam.

question.cn: 把果酱卖给小裁缝之后，妇人是何感受？
question.en: How was the woman after she sold the jam to the little tailor?

analysis: 文中提到：“The woman, who had expected to find a good customer, gave him what he asked for, but went away angry and disappointed.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 甜美的果酱吸引了什么？
question.en: What did the sweet smell of the jam attract？

analysis: 文中提到：“But the smell of the sweet jam was spreading through the room and attracted many flies, who quite agreed with the tailor that the jam was delicious.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么小裁缝想要去外面看看？
question.en: Why did the little tailor begin to thinking of going out into the world?

options.en: Because the world was so big.

options.cn: 因为他觉得他的小作坊跟他的伟大不相配。
options.en: Because he thought that his small workshop didn’t match his greatness.

analysis: 文中提到：“The tailor put on the belt, and began to think of going out into the world, for his workshop seemed too small for a man of his greatness.” 因此答案选C。
